wikipedia_page.main: Willie Watson (7 March 1920 – 24 April 2004) was an English cricketer, who played for Yorkshire, Leicestershire and England. He was a double international, as Watson was also a footballer who played for England's national team. He was  the son of Billy Watson, and brother of  Albert Watson, also footballers.

response: * Willie Watson (footballer, born 1910), Scottish footballer (Hibernian, Ayr United)

* Willie Watson (New Zealand cricketer) (born 1965), New Zealand cricketer
* Willie Watson (bowls), Irish international lawn bowler

link_mentions.page: English cricket team in the West Indies in 1953–54

response: Pringle's first recorded match for Kenya came against Uganda in December 1958. He represented Kenya and several invitational teams against the Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) on its 1963-64 tour of East Africa, notably dismissing England players Willie Watson, Colin Milburn and Micky Stewart. In 1967, he scored 52 not out and took 4/99 against India, returning from its unsuccessful tour of England.
